title: Recovering Thunderbird inbox Mac OS X 10.7.5
content: I have an old iMac running Snow Leopard I think--10.7.5. I am a Windows person, but got this little desktop back in the day for my daughter for movie projects, hobby websites, desktop publishing etc. I also used it as an email backup. I have an old version of Thunderbird loaded on it and was downloading email periodically from a pop account. I changed providers awhile ago and today tried to set up the new account on the iMac. I was stymied by a setting I could not locate on the old version of Thunderbird, and I accidentally removed the existing account and my inbox and subfolders disappeared. I checked a Time Machine backup figuring I was covered by that, but for whatever reason, there is no backup of Thunderbird, just the proprietary Apple mail app which contained nothing. I rooted around and found the pop account buried in my user profile (which is to say I am not sure where this actually is) and I see the inbox and sub folders with .sbd and .msf extensions. Is there a way to import these into Thunderbird again? Many thanks.
creator: terri_walker

title: Internet Service Provider
content: Do I use my Internet Service Provider address or another free email address when setting up Thunderbird.
creator: julie.m_martens

title: Emails not visible after updating to version 128.2.3esr (64-bit)
content:
I noticed missing(?) emails on the day of the recent TB update (09/20/2024). The folder structure is correct and visible. There are just under 100 'Local Folders' under the primary email account. Less than a dozen folders/subfolders display a few recent individual emails (no folders display all emails). The rest of the folders do not display any emails.

The folders directly under the mail account heading/title (Inbox, Drafts, Sent, Junk and Deleted) are all still correct and continue to perform as expected.

I can find the 'missing' emails in the C:\Users\******\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\43nl1huh.default-release\Mail\Local Folders

How can I 'point' the emails to their respective Local Folders?

Hardware: Device name ThinkPad - P17 Processor Intel(R) Core(TM) i9-10885H CPU @ 2.40GHz 2.40 GHz Installed RAM 64.0 GB (63.7 GB usable) Device ID 113CDE18-4058-45E2-9D9E-F65000C8A3CD Product ID 00330-53358-18448-AAOEM System type 64-bit operating system, x64-based processor Pen and touch No pen or touch input is available for this display C- Drive CT1000P5SSD8 - 931.51 GBs (55% free)

OS: Edition Windows 11 Pro Version 23H2 Installed on ‎9/‎28/‎2022 OS build 22631.4169 Updated 2024-09-11 Cumulative Update for Windows 11 Version 23H2 (KB5043076)

Thunderbird is 128.2.3esr (64-bit) on the esr update channel. The mail server is IMAP

Things I've tried from TB support forums...

1.) Check your antivirus settings or firewall settings, they might be blocking you from receiving mails in your account. 

   Repair your folder - Right click on folder > properties and Repair folder.    Check you trash and delete folder. If mail is there then restore it.    Check connection between your account and server.    Clear cache and remove unwanted Add-ons

2.) In Thunderbird 

   Menu app icon > tools > click on 'clear recent history'    Help > Troubleshooting Information    click on 'Open folder'    A window opens showing contents of profile name folder.    Exit Thunderbird. 
   Delete the following files - note some files may not have been created    folderCache.json    folderTree.json    virtualFolders.dat    global-messages-db.sqlite    panacea.dat    session.json    xulstore.json 
   Click on 'Mail' folder    Delete the 'smart mailboxes' folder - if you see one    If you use pop accounts or problems in 'Local folders', select those folders and delete the *msf files. 
   start Thunderbird using 'Run as Administrator' - this is important.    Right click on the Thunderbird shortcut icon and select 'Run as Administrator'
creator: jeffbrad

title: Retrieval using the IMAP4 protocol failed for the following message
content:
Hi, I have been using Thunderbird for 3 years. It worked well in the past. However, Thunderbird failed to download an email yesterday. I can read this email both on website and my phone. The error message is as below:

Retrieval using the IMAP4 protocol failed for the following message: 4319

Subject: xxxx From: xxxx Sent date: 9/23/2024 1:54:27 PM

The message hasn't been deleted. You might be able to view it using either Outlook or Outlook Web App. You can also contact the sender to find out what the message says.

title: threads
content:
Hi,

New to Thunderbird. I have eight email accounts: one gmail, one microsoft, and two in each of my three domains. I have successfully created a unified folder and all my accounts are in there. However, I have three problems.

1 In the unified view, sometimes (and I cannot detremine what triggers this) the first four addresses "disappear". This only occurs with the inbox. All other folders suchs as drafts, sent, etc., display all eight addresses.

2 I cannot prevent TB from threading. I read somehwere that changing teh value of "mailnews.default_view_flags" to zero would prevent threading. It has to some degree but I still have threads. Is there a way to permananently and completely disable or even remove the threading option?

3 I have archiving switched off in all accounts. But I still have emails being archived. Like threading, I would like to permanently and completely delete this feature.

Any assistance would be gratefully appreciated! Jack
creator: jack168

title: Thunderbird 115-128 Copying messages to the sent folder IMAP ERROR
content: Copying messages to the sent folder IMAP problem since version 115. In the company since version 115 there have been problems with placing sent messages in the IMAP sent folder. The problem appears randomly. The problem remained until version 128.2.2. When Thunderbird cannot place a message in the sent folder, it is possible to save the sent message in the local folder. However, it takes a few minutes before it is possible. The recipient of the message receives the message normally. Killing the Thunderbird process and restarting the program helped, after restarting Thunderbird the message was sent normally and copied to the IMAP sent folder correctly. At first we thought that the problem was with the "home.pl" hosting. We spent a lot of time testing with them, as well as with the ORANGE internet provider. Without success. A few days ago we returned to version 102.15.1 x86 (32bit) for one employee. Since then, he has not experienced any problems with sending messages. I would like YOU to investigate what was changed in versions 115 and 128 that might cause such a problem. If the employee does not have any problems for another week, we need to revert to version 102.15.1 for all employees. However, we know that this is not a safe solution. We should have the latest version of Thunderbird working properly. Please help.
creator: inf3rnovip

title: Continued problems with use of the Mozilla email function after a software update from Thunderbird a month or so ago
content:
Reply to Wayne Mery --

RE: gmail is configured in Thunderbird as pop account? Or imap?

Did you create subfolders in your Inbox?

How many messages in Inbox?

My response:

Your request for answer to your questions did not give me an email that accepts message so I am trying this method again.

My Gmail is configured as IMAP. The university Gmail account is under the university's email system. It is forwarded to my Mozilla Thunderbird account on my computer via the specific drive for the library (which we call the M drive). So the emails are in two places. I do not maintain a back file of emails of more than 12 months on the original Gmail account which currently has 25,000 emails on it. (I do a wholesale slaughter every few months.)

My folders/subfolders are under "Local Folders" which appears to NOT be under my Inbox.

I have currently about 5,300 emails in my Inbox. I have no clue how many emails I have under the NUMEROUS folders/subfolders. My emails only go back to Jan. 2020 since my computer died and the software and all the emails were on the hard drive of the computer.

It is difficult to do my maintenance since deleting an email can cause the system to crash. This past weekend I trashed numerous folders that were duplicates, and then duplicates of those duplicates of the original folder. I approximate over 100,000 emails were removed from all of the duplication.

Today I tried to remove OLD folders that I don't need anymore which now reside under the TRASH folder under the LOCAL FOLDER. When they are deleted, they show up under the TRASH folder under the INBOX. When I delete them from there, they will disappear. But every time I delete folders, it crashes, so I have to reboot. In other words, it is slow going.

VICKI TATE

-- Vicki L Tate Head, Documents/Serials University Libraries vtate@southalabama.edu Depository 0007B P: (251) 460-7024 ______

University of South Alabama Marx Library 222 5901 USA Drive North Mobile, AL 36688

www.southalabama.edu/departments/library/docs.html
creator: vtate

title: I am unable to delete folders that I created myself.
content:
I am unable to delete folders that I have created myself. When I click on the folder and click Delete, nothing happens.These folders were created by me to enable me to store important emails related to one topic. Some of the folders were quite old, but most of them now are folders that I created recently.

Attempts that I have made:

  • I was able to delete the contents of the folders, hoping that after that I could delete the folders. I was still unable to delete the folders.
  • I thought if I renamed these folders I could delete them. I was also unable to rename the folders.
  • I created another folders called "can't delete" and placed all the folders that I can't delete into that folder. I tried to delete the whole "can't delete" folder, again without success.
  • I also tried to delete the folders by moving them to other existing folders, and then tried to delete them, again no success.

Can someone please assist.
creator: elise6
